private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels.
Vowel blocks in this problem are A, E, and I.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack or on the table.
I can move at most one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final configuration matches the target tower where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, and M is on the table.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants.
Consonant blocks in this problem are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack or on the table.
I can move at most one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final configuration matches the target tower where A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, and M is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their analyses into a complete planning model.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward planner.
I must keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the multi-agent PDDL model.
orchestrator.goal: Generate a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the two-agent block manipulation task so the FastDownward solver can produce a plan that achieves the required final tower configuration.

public_information: There are thirteen uniquely labelled blocks: K I E H L G B A J M F C D.
Blocks can only be moved if they are at the top of a stack or on the table.
Each move picks up a single top block and places it on top of another stack or on the table.
One agent may only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks and the other agent may only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks.

Initial stacks are the following two stacks. Stack 1 from bottom to top is K then I then H then A then C then D where K is on the table and D is the top. Stack 2 from bottom to top is E then L then G then B then J then M then F where E is on the table and F is the top.

The goal configuration is a single tower with A on top of B, B on top of C, C on top of D, D on top of E, E on top of F, F on top of G, G on top of H, H on top of I, I on top of J, J on top of K, K on top of L, L on top of M, and M on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Provide an analysis of the current block configuration and the moves that you as the vowel-only agent can legally perform. Do not emit PDDL. Describe which vowel blocks are currently accessible, which stacks they reside in, and what intermediate relocations would help expose or place vowel blocks to reach the global goal. List constraints that arise from your limitation to vowels and from the top-of-stack requirement.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following public information {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a clear enumeration of legal atomic moves you can perform, prioritized suggestions for intermediate placements, and any assumptions you require the orchestrator or the other agent to satisfy.

report.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Provide an analysis of the current block configuration and the moves that you as the consonant-only agent can legally perform. Do not emit PDDL. Describe which consonant blocks are currently accessible, which stacks they reside in, and what intermediate relocations would help expose or place consonant blocks to reach the global goal. List constraints that arise from your limitation to consonants and from the top-of-stack requirement.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following public information {environment->public_information}. You have the following private knowledge {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a clear enumeration of legal atomic moves you can perform, prioritized suggestions for intermediate placements, and any assumptions you require the orchestrator or the other agent to satisfy.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the analyses from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward planner. You must model two agent types and keep their actions distinct. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain should include actions for moving a top block by the vowel agent and by the consonant agent, with preconditions enforcing top-of-stack and label restrictions. The problem should encode the initial stacks and the target tower. Target the FastDownward planner in your modeling choices.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator and you received the following inputs. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the vowel agent analysis: {vowel_report}. Here is the consonant agent analysis: {consonant_report}. Your job is to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that represents both agents, their action restrictions, the initial configuration, and the target configuration described in the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Output the PDDL domain and problem so they are ready for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
